quote: Despite its advantages, monocular depth estimation faces significant challenges, including depth ambiguity and difficulty in preserving depth boundary details.
Depth estimation has emerged as a critical area of research, driven by the demand for precise and efficient methods across diverse applications.
The proposed approach captures internal correlation within spatial dimensions through feature maps, using skip connections to bring back local details.
The objective of gradient loss function is to enforce gradient consistency between the predicted and actual depth maps.
The results illustrate that the proposed method markedly enhances interpretation of depth in indoor scenes.
The issue of depth perception is a crucial aspect of computer vision, which has been the focus of attention of numerous researchers, resulting in significant advances in recent decades.
The proposed model produces clean boundaries, making it suitable for 3D modeling of scenes.
